channel.title: Cooking on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Cooking on jverkamp.com

item.title: Mostly homemade pumpkin pie
item.description:
Pumpkin pie, truly the reason for the season.

Other than the crust, everything is made from scratch! Including the whipped cream.

item.title: Oven sheet omelette
item.description:
Cooked something worth blogging about, if only because it’s so easy.

Ingredients

  • Ground beef (cooked and seasoned)
  • 3 small potatoes
  • A dozen eggs
  • An onion
  • Cheese

Recipe

  • Preheat oven to 425â„‰
  • Slice the potatoes thinly (I used a food processor)
  • Pre-cook the potatoes for 5 minutes in the microwave
  • Spray a deep oven sheet
  • Put down a layer of potatoes and onions, then the beef
  • Pour eggs over the whole thing
  • Bake for 10 minutes
  • Slice and server

In progress, we have everything ready to go in the oven:

item.title: Cheesy chicken a la slow cooker
item.description: To continue our weekend of cooking, we tried aÂ recipeÂ from the slow cooker recipie book I got for Christmas (or maybe my birthday, I don’t actually remember which): four ingredient cheesy chicken!

item.title: Popcorn chicken
item.description: We cooked something new this weekend (or at least something I don’t think I’ve blogged about it before), so I figured I should dust off this categoryÂ and post something for once. What did we make? Popcorn chicken!

item.title: Pizza omelette
item.description:
Want to make a pizza but don’t have a crust?

Bam:

Pizza omelette.

item.title: Tortilla espanola
item.description: It’s been a while since I’ve posted any cooking, so I figured why not have something new. This time, we decided to make a tortilla–and not the Mexican sort (although that would be interesting to try some time), but rather the Spanish sort. Instead of a floury disk of tastiness, we have potatoes and eggs (also of tastiness).

item.title: Homemade cheese!
item.description:
Today, we made cheese! Taking the idea from a post on PinterestÂ and a cheese making kit from Amazon, we decided to go ahead and make cheese!

Ingredients:

  • one gallon of milk (we used Vitamin D milk from Kroger)
  • this cheese making kit from Amazon
  • pots and stirring things
  • a colander
  • water and ice

item.title: Umm... soup?
item.description: Half on a bet, we made two dishes this weekend with only a single difference: the sauce. The original goal was to make Indian and Mexian, but the Kroger where we picked up supplies this time around doesn’t have the same selection of Indian sauces. So instead we went with Chinese. Turns out, that was a really interestingÂ decision… ðŸ˜„

item.title: Chicken and tomatoes
item.description:
Today we have one of those simple recipes when you’re short on prep time but still want something delicious.

You’ll need:

  • chicken
  • rice
  • tomatoes
  • herbs and spices (we used basil and oregano)
  • olive oil

item.title: Portobello pizzas!
item.description:
Love pizza but concerned with the number of calories in the standard pizza crust? Why not make portobello pizzas! it’s just like a pizza except you use a mushroom instead of the crust. (Disclaimer: If you don’t like mushrooms in the first place, thisÂ probablyÂ isn’t the best idea for you…)

You’ll need:

  • portobello mushrooms
  • pizza sauce
  • cheese
  • other pizza toppings

(Look at the AllRecipes post for more details)

item.title: It's a pizza... it's spaghetti...
item.description: … it’s pizzaghetti!

item.title: Grilled oops
item.description: Some part of my always wondered what would happen to a grilled cheese if you left it on the Foreman Grill and forgot about it…

item.title: Burger wrap
item.description:
Cheeseburger got you down? Not as interesting as it used to be?

Try a burger wrap!

item.title: 'tis the season...
item.description: …for pancakes! Pancakes, whipped cream, and sprinkles–where could they possibly go wrong?

item.title: Mini pizza cups and tortilla pizzas
item.description: A double treat today, we made mini pizza cups and tortilla pizzas.

item.title: Grilled-cheese-burger
item.description: Grilled cheese? Cheeseburger? You decide!

item.title: Homemade Pizza
item.description: Another thing to add to the list of things that are even tastier when homemade: Granted, we didn’t actually make the crust all of the way from the flour (we have to try that sometime!), but we did make it from a packet rather that just buying a pre-made crust. Also, it’s really fun to roll out the crust.

item.title: Chili a la wok
item.description:
One of my favorite dishes to make is a sort of chili. Since I don’t really have a strict recipe, it tends to vary wildly, but it’s always tasty and usually can feed me for a solid week.

As a rough outline, my “chili” usually contains:

  • some sort of meat (I’ve used ground beef, ground turkey, and chicken breast before)
  • vegetables (green peppers and onions at they very least)
  • starches (pasta, rice, and/or potatoes; I usually have at least two of these)
  • beans
  • tomatoes (canned, fresh, or tomato sauce; sometimes more than one)

item.title: Chicken/broccoli mush
item.description: I finally finished off the last of my chili, so I figure it might be time enough to try out the slow cooker I got for Christmas. Starting with what I hoped would be a relatively simple recipe, I combined rice,Â broccoli, and chicken (with some chicken broth for a base) and let it go.

item.title: Homemade Chimis!
item.description: After making homemade tortilla chips a couple of months ago, we knew that the next logical step would have to be to make chimichangas (what else?), so here we are.

item.title: Homemade tortilla chips
item.description:
We were in a frying sort of mood after yesterday’s pickle chips, so today we decided to make some homemade tortilla chips.

It’s actually a really simple process:

  • cut up a tortilla
  • fry the pieces

item.title: Corn-breaded Pickle Chips
item.description: Nope, I’m not kidding. The title is exactly accurate. It turns out you can corn-bread just about anything, including pickles!

item.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
item.description: Bell peppers are tasty. So are tomato sauce, beef, and cheese. So what if we took the latter and stuffed it inside of the former?

item.title: (corn)breaded everything!
item.description: Breaded things are tasty, but unfortunately I don’t have any breading. But what I do have is boxes of cornbread. Hmm. Wonder if that will work?

item.description: What do you get when you have a hankering for a nice cherry pie and not a pie tin in sight?

item.title: Pizza Pie
item.description:
Don’t tell me you’ve never considered it… Literally making a pizzaÂ pie? Putting pizza toppings in a pie shell?

Well not to worry! You don’t have to wonder anymore!

item.title: Homemade Ice cream
item.description:
We made homemade ice cream! Based on a post on Disney’s FamilyFun website, you need:

  • sugar
  • half and half
  • vanilla
  • salt
  • ice cubes
  • nested ziplock bags
